alert.note: Alert for Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 7:17AM EST until December 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Lehigh. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 713 AM EST, the USGS river gauges in Trexlertown were indicating rising waters as a result of the one to two inches of rain that has fallen. Water levels will remain high through the morning hours. - For Spring Creek at Trexlertown at Spring Creek: At 6:30am the stage was 4.42 feet. Flood Stage is 4.5 feet. ... For Little Lehigh at Trexlertown near Little Lehigh Creek: At 6:15am the stage was 4.06 feet. Flood Stage is 4.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
